attributes.action: Support the application for Arthur Rowley to be entered into the National Football Museum Hall of Fame
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Arthur Rowley was born in Wolverhampton in 1926. Playing for West Bromwich Albion, Leicester City, Fulham and Shrewsbury Town he scored 434 from 619 games which remains to this day a football league record.

He was also manager at Shrewsbury Town, Sheffield United, Southend United, Knighton Town and Oswestry Town.

Sadly Arthur Rowley passed away on December 19th 2002.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
